intro: Uragoga fissistipula, commonly known as the fissured-stippled uragoga, is a rare and specialized plant native to the high-altitude regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its unique leaf morphology, featuring deeply fissured and stippled surfaces that aid in water retention in its arid habitat. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with striking violet hues, which bloom during the wet season. Its root system is adapted to anchor in rocky substrates, providing stability in its harsh environment. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Uragoga fissistipula is considered a vulnerable species in conservation efforts.
